subNodes.conversationText: root

From ahead you hear a deep, angry growling and the heavy thud of armoured boots.

Before you have the chance to hide, a huge figure emerges from a branch in the path. You find yourself taking an involuntary step backwards. He is enormous! He must be seven feet tall, and radiates confidence and strength with every step.  

But the thing that takes you most by surprise is his head. He has the head of a bull.
Continue

"You there! <Race>! Are you the one called Darkfoot?"
 
The minotaur's eyes are brimming with anger.
"No. I'm not quite that pretentious."

The minotaur snorts.

"Do you know where this Darkfoot is hiding, then?"
"No, I've never heard of this Darkfoot character."

The minotaur lets out a low and slightly disturbing growl.

"He is a snake. A thief. He and his men stole my equipment. I know that there are here somewhere in the cemetery, but I haven't found them yet. When I do, I will tear their faces off for dishmats."
"Riiiiight. Ok, well good luck with that."
"It seems we have a common goal. I'm looking for these thieves as well - perhaps we should join up?"
"Are you sure this is a good idea? He doesn't seem entirely...stable."
"Bloody hell, have you seen the size of him? Of course it is a good idea!"
"Well... ok. But I'm not sure about this."
Continue
"Ignore your skinny female. I would be content for us to travel together and finish off these thieves. My name is Kangath."
"Welcome aboard Kangath. Let's go."
"....skinny female?!"
"Let it go, Mara."
"Maybe you're right. The thing about the dishcloths was a bit weird."
"If you do not want my strength at your side then you are a fool."
"No, I think Mara's right. It probably wouldn't work out. Good luck though."
"Yeah, you're right. We need all the help we can get. Welcome aboard."
"A wise choice." The minotaur nods. "My name is Kangath, and I am happy to travel with you for the time being."
"Welcome aboard, Kangath."
"No. I am <FullName>."

The minotaur glares at you.

"Then I would say well met, <FullName>, but it is not so. Do you know where Darkfoot is hiding?"
"No, I've never heard of this Darkfoot character."

The minotaur lets out a low and slightly disturbing growl.

"He is a snake. A thief. He and his men stole my equipment. I know that there are here somewhere in the cemetery, but I haven't found them yet. When I do, I will tear their faces off for dishmats."
